org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.document.association.spi

Class StructureOptimizerAssociationRowFactory<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.document.association.spi.StructureOptimizerAssociationRowFactory<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of key/value association rows supported by this factory.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AssociationRowFactory
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CouchDBAssociationRowFactory, MongoDBAssociationRowFactory

    public abstract class StructureOptimizerAssociationRowFactory<R>
extends Object
implements AssociationRowFactory
    Base class for AssociationRowFactory implementations which support association rows stored as key/value tuples as well as rows stored as collections of single values. Also removes top property from embedded id references. This is opening the way to optimise the storage and remove the column name from the structure for collections of single values.

    The single value form may be used to persist association rows with exactly one column (which is the case for collections of simple values such as ints, String s etc. as well as associations based on non-composite keys). In this case a row object of type R will be created using the column value and the single row key column which is not part of the association key.

    For rows with more than one column it is assumed that they are already of type R and they are thus passed through as is. If the referenced entity uses composite keys, the embedded id property name is removed from the reference. 'games': [ { 'id.id1': 'foo', 'id.id2': 'bar' } ] or 'games': [ { 'id': { 'id1': 'foo', 'id2': 'bar' } } ] are replaced by 'games': [ { 'id1': 'foo', 'id2': 'bar' } ]

    Author:
    Gunnar Morling, Emmanuel Bernard <emmanuel@hibernate.org>
